title: Does everything that has a name exist? - Quora

response.answer_text: No, not necessarily. For instance the maximum possible temperature possible in our universe is (just) 142 nonillion kelvins (i.e. 10^32 K); this is called the Planck Temperature. Similarly the minimun theoretically possible temperature, 0 K, is also non existent; called the Absolute Zero. Both of these are just theoretical ideas and are non existent.
